questions.prompt: Which quality allows a distributed system to keep operating even if one node crashes?
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance is the system’s ability to survive a node failure without downtime.

questions.prompt: How does role-based access control (RBAC) assign permissions?
questions.explanation: RBAC groups permissions under roles so that granting or removing a role updates a user’s effective access.

options.label: Permissions are tied to roles, and users inherit them by joining a role.
Permissions are granted directly to every individual user account.
Permissions are embedded in each hardware device.
Permissions are randomly rotated among logged-in users.

questions.prompt: Which XML snippet correctly represents <t> Alan and Mairi. dreamed. using the <t> tag?
questions.explanation: The <t> tag must wrap the entire expression and include the dreamed verb, making the second snippet the valid representation.

questions.prompt: An XML document has a tree structure. It:

options.label: can have multiple roots and multiple leaves
can have multiple roots or records

questions.explanation: Every well-formed XML document has exactly one root element, while leaves are unconstrained.

questions.prompt: What standard do Atom and RSS conform with?

Given the following XQuery code:

let $x := doc("courses.xml")/Courses
for $in in $x/Course
where $in/Level > 200
order by $in/Code
return <Course> {$in/Name, $in/Level, $in/Code} </Course>

Which line of the code defines the filter function?

Google’s Protocol Buffers are similar in syntax to:

options.label: Class definition of an object-oriented programming language

questions.prompt: What are the key features of a native XML database? Select all that apply.

options.label: No need to load the entire XML into memory
Allow queries for a subset of data in memory
Use the relational database query language

questions.prompt: Using the object-oriented concept of inheritance, what language is the base (parent) language of XQuery?
What are the main problems of using relational databases for XML databases where the XML has an irregular structure? Select all that apply.

options.label: It may create many null columns in a table for representing the data
It may create many tables for representing the data

questions.prompt: Google’s BigTable is used to store:
The idea behind Google’s BigTable is similar to that of:
Which data structures do NOT conform with XML standards? Select all that apply.
Assume we have five (5) different Web data structures, and we want to be able to translate each structure directly to other four (4) structures. How many converters do we need?
A JSON object consists of:
Which of the following are valid JSON values? Select all that apply.
Why do we need JSON instead of using general XML for all applications?

options.label: General XML is too simple to represent fixed data
General XML is a meta-language and can be used to define languages only
General XML represents a collection of data, unlike XML content
JSON is easier and faster for being processed by programming languages

questions.prompt: What technology best supports the thick client architecture?
What computing model and architecture does Pure HTML Web implement? Select all that apply.

options.label: Computing is done on client’s machine
Program is embedded in HTML file

questions.prompt: How are AJAX features implemented in ASP .Net applications?
What are the potential problems of using client-side scripting? Select all that apply.

options.label: Overhead of sending code back and forth
Interpretation is slower than executing compiled code

questions.prompt: AJAX control is implemented in the ASP .Net environment as:
What programming model best supports the thick client in the client-server architecture?
When an ASPX page is accessed from a browser, what is sent to the browser?

options.label: The source code of the ASPX page
An HTML page generated from the ASPX page
The HTML portion of the ASPX page
An XML page generated from the ASPX page

questions.prompt: A user control:

options.label: is always more powerful than a server control
is a component sharable among multiple pages
creates a separate page that can run upon each call

questions.prompt: How do we create an AJAX component in ASP .Net Web applications?

options.label: Create a user control and use parameters to implement the user controls

questions.prompt: What web computing models support thin-client architecture? Select all that apply.
AJAX control is implemented in the ASP .Net environment as:

options.label: is an object that forms a component in an ASPX page
is executed at the client side
can take input and emit an event upon an input

questions.prompt: A user control:

options.label: is faster in execution than a DLL function
is re-usable in an ASPX page
is a patch on an ASPX page

questions.prompt: Which of the following computing models can be considered to be in thick client architecture? Select all that apply.
Where are the compilation and debugging options of a Web application typically stored in the Web.config file?
Policy-based computing suggests to decouple:
A DLL component that you create:

options.label: must be under the same namespace and you are not required to include it explicitly
forms a namespace and you are required to explicitly include it in the application
forms a service server and you need to use "Add Service Reference" to include it
forms a service server and you need to use "Add Web Reference" to include it

questions.prompt: Where are the cookies typically stored?

options.label: On the top folder of the application domain on the server
In the ASP.Net folder of your application domain on the server
In the client’s hard drive, in a folder under the browser application
In the client’s hard drive, with the machine config file

questions.prompt: Session state variables can be accessed by:

options.label: the page only in which the session state is defined
the method only in which the session state is initialized

questions.prompt: Why do you need to create your own machine key if your ASP .Net application is hosted in a server farm environment?

options.label: A server farm does not have a machine key
A server farm does not have a unique machine key
A server farm does not need a machine key to generate the hashing ID
ASP .Net applications automatically generate a machine key when hosted in a server farm

questions.prompt: If one selects the cookieless attribute = UseUri to support Session State variables, the restrictions are:

options.label: Browser must remain open to retain session states

questions.prompt: The <appSettings> element in Web.config file are typically used for storing:
What are the challenges for defining a global variable in Global.asax file? Select all that apply:

options.label: Create global files that can coordinate with each other
Allow class instances to read the global file
Address the problem of simultaneous write on the variable
Address the performance problem if lock mechanism is used

questions.prompt: When session states are used, a Web server identifies a revisiting browser through an ID:

options.label: associated with the client TCP session

questions.prompt: Where do you store the secure machine key generated for your ASP .Net application?

options.label: In the Web.config file, in the element AppSettings
In the Web.config file, in the element system.web

questions.prompt: How can you prevent Web application deadlock in the case of copying data from one disk file to another disk file?

options.label: Open the two files in two different threads
Close one file before opening the other
Open the two files in random order
Open one for read and the other for write

questions.prompt: What is the proper order of performing security operations?

options.label: authorization, authentication, and then access of resource
access of resource, authentication, and then authorization
access of resource, authorization, and then authentication
authentication, authorization, and then access of resource

questions.prompt: Availability (A(t)) is probably related to the:

options.label: readiness of service at time point t
the validity and correctness of data and message
continuity of service in time period [0, t]

questions.prompt: In what configuration setting will ASP .Net use the security token passed to it by IIS?

options.label: <identity impersonate = "false" /> (Correct from screenshot — although A & B look identical, B is marked correct)
when impersonation element is not used

questions.prompt: How does the Windows security mechanism work in the Web application security control?

options.label: It blocks IP addresses and domains that are not permitted
It compares the received credential with the credential saved in Windows’s user accounts
It compares the received credential with the credential saved in a user-created XML file
It compares the received credential with the credential saved in the Web.Config file

questions.prompt: The probability that a system has survived in the time interval [0, t] is the system’s:
Data Encryption Standard (DES) is used for low-level security applications, because:

options.label: it has been used for many years.
it is encryption key that is short.
it uses a secretive key system.

questions.prompt: What techniques are used in Data Encryption Standard (DES) to perform encryption and decryption? Select all that apply.

options.label: a simple round of cipher encryption

questions.prompt: Data hashing creates a value from a given data. The hash value:

options.label: can be used for recovering the data using a decryption algorithm.
can uniquely identify a data; cannot recover the data.
creates a digital signature that is mixed with the data.
is generated using the encryption algorithm in the Open Key cryptography system.

questions.prompt: What reliability features does WS-Reliable Messaging specification guarantee? Select all that apply.

options.label: Messages received once and only once

questions.prompt: How is the lost message handled by WS-Reliable Messaging?

options.label: Double redundancy: Each message is sent twice.
Triple redundancy: Each message is sent three times.
A message is resent if no acknowledgment is received within the given amount of time.
The receiver creates the missing message based on the adjacent messages received.

questions.prompt: What are true about the n-out-of-k codes? Select all that apply.

options.label: It may not be able to tolerate all bit single errors.
It has a high level of redundancy, and the cost is high.

options.label: To make the data transmission more efficient
To make the encryption more manageable
To make the transmission more reliable

How is the WS-ReliableMessaging implemented in WCF?

options.label: A message is resent if no acknowledgment received.
Each message is sent three times.
